item.title: Leaf cleaning from pavements and Roads needed, 16th November
item.description:
There are a vast amount of leaves fallen from a tree on the pavement. It has spread across the road and pavement. It is particularly dangerous especially when it is wet as people can slip on them. Can someone from the council please clean the leaves. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Stephen's Terrace, Oval, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 56a Chesterfield Grove Fly Tipping Again, 16th November
item.description:
They have left their TV cardboard box and polystyrene packaging outside their residence on the public pavement causing a health and safety hazard. They have fly tipped many times. It needs to stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on the street always, 16th November
item.description:
This issue has been raised several times, yet the rubbish continues to be left on the street. London Carpet & Flooring Company is responsible for that building, and they are simply not taking any action. The situation has now become unacceptable: the street looks like a dump, and the smell spreads throughout the entire area. I kindly ask you to intervene by ensuring the street is cleaned and by formally notifying those responsible. Please also take appropriate measures against them, otherwise the situation will be the same again tomorrow. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Rotherhithe New Road, Bermondsey, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy lorry parked on pavement and caused the tarmac to sink leaving a deep and dangerous hole and also breaking the paving slabs, 16th November
item.description:
This was supposedly reported by the lorry driver approximately 2 years ago. It is now extremely dangerous and nothing has been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leamington Avenue, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pile rubbsih, 16th November

item.title: Avenue Road, Pickford Lane, 16th November
item.description:
Lots of litter today especially outside the charity shop in Pickford lane and along Avenue Road. A road sign has been left on the Green by the tree in Pickford Road and remains of litter again on the corner of Pickford Road on the green patch etc. Normally the litter has been collected daily so keeps these roads clean but today it looks as if we didn’t have any street cleaners.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of furniture, 16th November
item.description:
Furniture left on Doyle Close on Saturday 15th November & moved to parking area on Sunday 16th November

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Doyle Close, North End, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large growth of ivy overhanging footpath, 16th November
item.description:
Not only do tall people have to duck walking through this part of the footpath, at night the overgrowth completely blocks out the street light from illuminating the side between the houses. There are vents projecting from the houses at chest height and it is in TOTAL DARKNESS meaning you cannot even see where you are walking. The ivy needs to be COMPLETELY removed from the public side to restore light and safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durban Road, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fountain, 16th November
item.description:
Dear all The fountain had been working for a fair amount of time since the reopening of Dalston Square but is not any longer.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roseberry Place, Hackney, London
